content: roxana bartlett © 2025 quick & easy bed socks one of my grandchildren called recently and asked me to make bed socks for her cold feet at night i whipped these up using some leftover yarn they are a quick and easy knit and make a perfect gift for cold weather sleeping these are tube socks knit with no reinforcement in the heel or toe and are meant to be worn in bed and in cozy slippers the pattern includes yardage and instructions for making medium and large socks the ribbing gives them enough stretch to cover a variety of women s and men s sizes for reference the model is wearing a medium she is 5 5 and wears a size 7 shoe yarn heavy worsted approximately 200 yds for medium 300 yds for large needles size 7 double points or long circulars for magic loop makes 2 cast on cast on 36 40 stitches and join being careful not to twist the cast-on edge work in k2 p2 ribbing for 2 3 or desired length sock foot and leg k3 p1 * repeat until sock is 14 16 or desired length the sock is completely adjustable - the knitted tube accommodates both the length of the foot and the part of the leg you want to cover toe* round 1 knit round 2 *k2 k2 decrease repeat from * round 3 knit round 4 *k1 k 2togtog repeat from * round 5 *k2tog until 3 or 4 stitches remain cut yarn weave tail through remaining stitches and fasten securely *a slightly heavier yarn can be used for an extra cosy toe
